title: US stall could mean we all head for a fall
text:
For months, financial markets have been defying gravity, amid the political hurly-burly. But last week, the weight of economic reality began to be felt.

The FTSE 100 index of leading shares endured its worst drop in well over three years on Wednesday, shedding more than 3pc amid a global stock market sell-off.

The immediate catalyst was a World Trade Organisation (WTO) decision, opening the door for US tariffs on imports from the EU. The latest chapter in the long-running Boeing-Airbus state subsidy dispute, this WTO ruling sets the stage for a showdown between Washington and Brussels.

There are other big issues swirling – the US-China trade dispute, a possible White House impeachment, Middle...
description: For months, financial markets have been defying gravity, amid the political hurly-burly.
